title: Average Catch — AvC

what: Beddington and Kirkwood life-history MP — BK
title: Beddington and Kirkwood life-history MP — BK
text: Family management procedures sets TAC approximation Fmax based length first capture relative asymptotic length von Bertalanffy growth parameter K.

title: Beddington and Kirkwood life-history MP — BK
code: BK(x, Data, reps = 100, plot = FALSE)  BK_CC(x, Data, reps = 100, plot = FALSE, Fmin = 0.005)  BK_ML(x, Data, reps = 100, plot = FALSE)

title: Beddington and Kirkwood life-history MP — BK
text: x position data object Data data object reps number stochastic samples MP recommendation(s) plot Logical. Show plot? Fmin minimum fishing mortality rate derived catch-curve (interval censor).

title: Beddington and Kirkwood life-history MP — BK
text: object class Rec-class TAC slot populated numeric vector length reps

title: Beddington and Kirkwood life-history MP — BK
text: TAC calculated : $$\textrm{TAC} = F_{\textrm{max}}$$ \(\) (vulnerable) stock abundance, \(F_{\textrm{max}}\) calculated : $$F_{\textrm{max}} = \frac{0.6K}{0.67-L_c/L_\infty}$$ \(K\) von Bertalanffy growth coefficient, \(L_c\) length first capture, \(L_\infty\) von Bertalanffy asymptotic length Abundance () either assumed known (BK) estimated (BK_CC BK_ML): $$= \frac{\bar{C}}{\left(1-e^{-F}\right)}$$ \(\bar{C}\) mean catch, F estimated. See Functions section estimation F.

title: Beddington and Kirkwood life-history MP — BK
text: BK: Assumes abundance known, .e. Data@Abun Data@CV_abun contain values BK_CC: Abundance estimated using age-based catch curve estimate Z F, abundance estimated recent catches F. BK_ML: Abundance estimated using mean length estimate Z F, abundance estimated recent catches F.

title: Beddington and Kirkwood life-history MP — BK
text: Note Beddington-Kirkwood method designed estimate \(F_\textrm{max}\), , fishing mortality produces maximum yield assuming constant recruitment independent spawning biomass. Beddington Kirkwood (2005) recommend estimating F using methods (e.g., catch curve) comparing estimated F estimated \(F_\textrm{max}\) adjusting exploitation accordingly. MPs implemented way.

title: Age-Composition Stock-Reduction Analysis — CompSRA
text: stock reduction analysis (SRA) model fitted age-composition last 3 years (less fewer data available) assuming constant total mortality rate (Z) used estimate current stock depletion (D), \(F_\textrm{MSY}\), stock abundance (). Abundance estimated SRA. \(F_{\textrm{MSY}}\) calculated assuming knife-edge vulnerability age full selection. TAC calculated \(F_\textrm{MSY} \). CompSRA4010 uses 40-10 harvest control rule reduce TAC low biomass.

title: Depletion-Based Stock Reduction Analysis — DBSRA
text: DB-SRA assumes complete time-series catch beginning exploitation available. Users prescribe estimates current depletion \((D)\), biomass MSY relative unfished \(\left(\frac{B_\textrm{MSY}}{B_0}\right)\), natural mortality rate \((M)\), ratio fishing mortality MSY M \(\left(\frac{F_{\textrm{MSY}}}{M}\right)\). may noticed -user- specify three factors make quota recommendation. can quite subjective method. MSE MSY reference points (e.g., \(\left(\frac{F_\textrm{MSY}}{M}\right)\)) taken true value calculate MSE added uncertainty specified Obs object (e.g Obs@FMSY_Mbiascv). catch limit, Base Version, calculated : $$\textrm{TAC} = M \frac{F_{\textrm{MSY}}}{M} D B_0$$

title: Depletion-Based Stock Reduction Analysis — DBSRA
text: DBSRA: Base Version. TAC calculated assumed MSY harvest rate multiplied estimated current abundance (estimated B0 x Depletion) DBSRA_40: Base Version assumes 40 percent current depletion (Bcurrent/B0 = 0.4), less optimistic state stock (ie close BMSY/B0 many stocks). DBSRA4010: Base version paired 40-10 rule linearly throttles back TAC depletion 0.4 zero 10 percent unfished biomass.

title: Depletion Corrected Average Catch — DCACs
text: method calculates depletion-corrected average catch (dcac) : $$\textrm{dcac} = \frac{\sum_{y=1}^{n}{C_y}}{n+(1-D)/Y_{\textrm{pot}}}$$ $$Y_{\textrm{pot}} = \frac{B_{\textrm{MSY}}}{B_0}\frac{F_{\textrm{MSY}}}{M}M$$ \(C\) historical catches; .e \(C\) change future projections MSE methods differ assumptions current depletion (D). See Functions section details.

title: Depletion Corrected Average Catch — DCACs
text: DCACs: Depletion updated future projections. TAC static updated future years. represents application DCAC method catch limit calculated based current estimate depletion time-series catch beginning fishery, TAC fixed level future projections. DCAC: Depletion estimated management interval used update catch limit recommendation based historical catch (updated future projections). DCAC_40: Current stock biomass assumed exactly 40 per cent unfished levels. 40 percent depletion assumption may really affect DCAC much already makes TAC recommendations quite MSY-like. DCAC4010: dynamic DCAC (depletion updated) paired 40-10 rule throttles back OFL zero 10 percent unfished stock size (OFL subject downward adjustment 40 percent unfished). DCAC can overfish BMSY levels. 40-10 harvest control rule largely resolves problem providing MP surprisingly good performance even low stock levels. DCAC_ML: variant uses mean length estimator calculate current stock depletion. mean length extension programmed Gary Nelson part excellent R package 'fishmethods'. DAAC: Depletion Adjusted Average Catch: essentially DCAC (updated Depletion) divided BMSY/B0 (Bpeak) (Harford Carruthers, 2017). HDAAC: Hybrid Depletion Adjusted Average Catch: essentially DCAC  (updated Depletion) divided BMSY/B0 (Bpeak) BMSY, DCAC BMSY (Harford Carruthers 2017).

title: Depletion Corrected Average Catch — DCACs
text: probably worth noting DCAC TAC recommendations tend zero depletion tends zero. adjusts depletion calculating historical average catch. follows stock levels much BMSY, DCAC tends chronically overfish.

Surplus production year y calculated : $$SP_y = B_{y+1} - B_y + C_y$$ Trends historical catch (C) biomass (B) estimated using loess smoother, last yrsmth years, available catch time-series abundance, calculated index abundance (Data@Ind) estimate abundance (Data@Abun) current year.

title: Adaptive Fratio — Fadapt
text: Fishing rate modified year according gradient surplus production biomass (aims zero).  F bounded FMSY/2 2FMSY walks logit space according dSP/dB. derived theory Maunder 2014. TAC calculated : $$\textrm{TAC}_y= F_y B_{y-1}$$ \(B_{y-1}\) recent biomass, estimated loess smoother recent yrsmth years index abundance (Data@Ind) estimate current abundance (Data@Abun), $$F_y = F_{\textrm{lim}_1} + \left(\frac{\exp^{F_{\textrm{mod}_2}}} {1 + \exp^{F_{\textrm{mod}_2}}} F_{\textrm{lim}_3} \right)   $$ \(F_{\textrm{lim}_1} = 0.5 \frac{F_\textrm{MSY}}{M}M\), \(F_{\textrm{lim}_2} = 2 \frac{F_\textrm{MSY}}{M}M\), \(F_{\textrm{lim}_3}\) \(F_{\textrm{lim}_2} - F_{\textrm{lim}_1}\), \(F_{\textrm{mod}_2}\) $$F_{\textrm{mod}_1} + g -G$$ \(g\) gain parameter gg, G predicted surplus production given current abundance, : $$F_{\textrm{mod}_1} =              \left\{\begin{array}{ll}              -2 & \textrm{} F_\textrm{old} < F_{\textrm{lim}_1} \\              2 & \textrm{}  F_\textrm{old} > F_{\textrm{lim}_2} \\              \log{\frac{F_\textrm{frac}}{1-F_\textrm{frac}}} & \textrm{} F_{\textrm{lim}_1} \leq F_\textrm{old} \leq F_{\textrm{lim}_2} \\              \end{array}\right.            $$ \(-F_{\textrm{frac}} = \frac{F_{\textrm{old}} - F_{\textrm{lim}_1}}{F_{\textrm{lim}_3}} \), \(F_\textrm{old} = \sum{\frac{C_\textrm{hist}}{B_\textrm{hist}}}/n\) \(C_\textrm{hist}\) \(B_\textrm{hist}\) smooth catch biomass last yrsmth, \(n\) yrsmth. Tested Carruthers et al. 2015.

title: Geromont and Butterworth target CPUE and catch MP — GB_target
text: TAC calculated :  \(I_\textrm{recent} \geq I_0\): $$\textrm{TAC}= C_\textrm{ref}  \left(w + (1-w)\frac{I_\textrm{rec}-I_0}{I_\textrm{target}-I_0} \right) $$ else: $$\textrm{TAC}= wC_\textrm{ref}  \frac{I_\textrm{rec}}{I_0}^2$$ \(C_\textrm{ref}\) reference catch assumed proxy MSY (Data@Cref), w gain parameter, \(I_\textrm{rec}\) average index last 4 years, \(I_\textrm{target}\) target Index (Data@Iref), \(I_0\) 0.2 x average index past 5 years. MSE \(C_\textrm{ref}\) calculated MSY subject observation error defined Obs@CV_Cref, \(I_\textrm{target}\) assumed index MSY subject observation error (Obs@CV_Iref). Consequently, performance method MSE strongly determined specified uncertainty parameters. TAC subject following conditions: next TAC > 1.2 last catch, TAC = 1.2 last catch next TAC < 0.8 last catch, TAC = 0.8 last catch

title: Index Confidence Interval — ICI
text: TAC calculated : $$\textrm{TAC}_y=C_{y-1} \alpha$$ \(C_{y-1}\) catch previous year, \(\alpha\) defined : $$\alpha =              \left\{\begin{array}{ll}              d & \textrm{} < \textrm{CI}_L \\              u & \textrm{} > \textrm{CI}_H \\              1 & \textrm{} \textrm{CI}_L \leq \leq \textrm{CI}_H \\              \end{array}\right.            $$ \(\) index recent year, \(d\) 0.75 ICI ICI2, \(u\) 1.05 1.25 forICI ICI2 respectively, \(\textrm{CI}_L\) \(\textrm{CI}_L\) lower upper bound confidence interval mean historical index. confidence interval calculated using Z-scores described Functions section .

title: Index Confidence Interval — ICI
text: ICI: catch reduced 0.75 Z-score current year's index less -0.44. catch increased 1.05 Z-score current year's index greater 1.96. Otherwise, catch held constant. ICI2: method less precautionary two ICI MPs allowing larger increase TAC lower threshold index decrease TAC. catch reduced 0.75 Z-score current year's index less -1.96. catch increased 1.25 Z-score current year's index greater 1.96. Otherwise, catch held constant.

title: Incremental Index Target MP — Itarget1
text: Four index/CPUE target MPs proposed Geromont Butterworth 2014. Tested Carruthers et al. 2015. title: Intrinsic rate of Increase MP — Rcontrol
text: TAC calculated : $$\textrm{TAC} = \textrm{SP} (1-gG)$$ \(g\) gain parameter, \(\textrm{SP}\) estimated surplus production, \(G\) : Rcontrol:  \(G = r (1-2D)\) \(r\) estimated intrinsic rate increase, \(D\) assumed depletion. Rcontrol2: \(G = r - 2bB_\textrm{hist}\) \(B_\textrm{hist}\) smoothed biomass overlast yrsmth years : $$b = \sum{\frac{\textrm{SP}}{B_\textrm{hist}} - r} \frac{\sum{B_\textrm{hist}}}{\sum{B_\textrm{hist}^2}}   $$. TAC subject conditions limit maximum change smoothed catch last yrsmth years glim argument, e.g, default values glim = c(0.5, 2) means maximum decrease TAC 50% average catch maximum increase 2 x average catch.

title: SBT simple MP — SBT1
text: SBT1 TAC calculated : $$\textrm{TAC}_y =              \left\{\begin{array}{ll}               C_{y-1} (1+K_2 \left| \lambda \right| ) & \textrm{} \lambda \geq 0 \\               C_{y-1} (1-K_1 \left| \lambda \right| ^\gamma) & \textrm{} \lambda < 0\\              \end{array}\right.            $$ \(\lambda\) slope index last yrmsth years, \(K_1\), \(K_2\), \(\gamma\) arguments MP. SBT2 TAC calculated : $$\textrm{TAC}_y = 0.5 (C_{y-1} + C_\textrm{targ}\delta)$$ \(C_{y-1}\) catch previous year, \(C_{\textrm{targ}}\) target catch (Data@Cref), : $$\delta=              \left\{\begin{array}{ll}              R^{1-\textrm{epsR}} & \textrm{} R \geq 1 \\              R^{1+\textrm{epsR}} & \textrm{} R < 1 \\              \end{array}\right.            $$ \(\textrm{epsR}\) control parameter : \(R = \frac{\bar{r}}{\phi}\) \(\bar{r}\) mean recruitment last tauR years \(\phi\) mean recruitment last 10 years. exactly proposed methods stochastic implementation. method tend work well many circumstances possibly due lack 'tuning' occurs real SBT assessment environment. try asking Rich Hillary CSIRO approach.

title: Surplus production based catch-limit modifier — SPmod
text: Note exactly Mark previously suggested stochastic implementation. TAC calculated : $$\textrm{TAC}_y =              \left\{\begin{array}{ll}               C_{y-1} \textrm{bet}_1 & \textrm{} r < \alpha_1 \\               C_{y-1} & \textrm{} \alpha_1 < r < \alpha_2 \\               \textrm{bet}_2 (b_2 - b_1 + C_{y-2} )  & \textrm{} r > \alpha_2 \\              \end{array}\right.            $$ \(\textrm{bet}_1\) \(\textrm{bet}_2\) elements bet, \(r\) ratio index recent two years, \(C_{y-1}\) catch previous year, \(b_1\) \(b_2\) ratio index \(y-2\) \(y-1\) estimate catchability \(\left(\frac{}{}\right)\), \(\alpha_1\), \(\alpha_2\), \(\alpha_3\) specified argument alp.

title: Slope in surplus production MP — SPslope
text: Note exactly Mark previously suggested stochastic implementation. TAC calculated : $$\textrm{TAC}_y =              \left\{\begin{array}{ll}               M \bar{C}  & \textrm{} r < \alpha_1 \\               \bar{C} & \textrm{} \alpha_1 < r < \alpha_2 \\               \textrm{bet}_2 \textrm{SP}  & \textrm{} r > \alpha_2 \\              \end{array}\right.            $$ \(r\) ratio predicted biomass next year biomass current year \(\bar{C}\) mean catch last yrmsth years, \(\alpha_1\)  \(\alpha_2\) specified alp, \(\textrm{bet}_1\) \(\textrm{bet}_2\) specified bet, \(\textrm{SP}\) estimated surplus production recent year, : $$M = 1-\textrm{bet}_1 \frac{B_y - \tilde{B}_y}{B_y}$$ \(B_y\) recent estimate biomass \(\tilde{B}\) predicted biomass next year.

title: DLMtool 5.3
text: runMSE function now robust. MPs fail (.e. crash R) now skipped without stopping entire MSE. warning message alerts users MPs dropped analysis. runMSE(Hist=TRUE) returns new S4 object class ‘Hist’. change means information historical simulations now accessed using @ instead $. example: Hist <- runMSE(Hist=TRUE) TS <- Hist@TSdata # time-series data Data <- Hist@Data # Data object end historical period runMSE(Hist=TRUE) now works parallel processing cheat sheets updated. can accessed within R console using cheatsheets now possible specify time-varying movement areas using OM@cpars$mov. Uses function added return MPs use particular data slot. example: Uses('AvC) Depletion initial year simulations can now specified using OM@cpars$initD. Real indices abundance can added Data object used condition OM. calculations unfished MSY reference points standardized now fully described userguide New functions PMLimit PMObj added generate interacive HTML tables showing performance MPs (using objects class PM) argument Labels added TradePlot function related functions (Tplot etc). allows users replace default MP name something user-friendly. example: TradePlot(MSE, Labels=list(AvC="Average Catch")). argument cols also added users full control colors points labels. MP labels can removed completely setting lab.size argument NULL

title: DLMtool 5.3
text: slots specifying gradients life-history parameters (e.g Stock@Mgrad, Stock@Linfgrad) removed. Time-varying parameters now specified OM@cpars. Biological reference points (SSB0, BMSY, FMSY, etc) now calculated using running average life-history selectivity parameters period equal age maturity simulation. See userguide information. AnnualMSY argument now deprecated. MSY reference points now always calculated every time-step. runMSErobust function now removed package (broken previous version).

title: DLMtool 5.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-03-18

title: DLMtool 5.1
text: Mixed MPs: now possible design MPs combine Output Input controls. Previously, MPs DLMtool either class ‘Input’ class ‘Output’. changed, MPs now class ‘MP’ return standard recommendation object (‘Rec’) allows specification combination catch limit, effort limit, spatial closure, size--selection /size--retention regulations. MP types: convenience, MPs can categorised 4 types: ‘Output’ (catch limits), ‘Input’ (spatial, effort, /size regulations), ‘Mixed’ (combination Output Input regulations), ‘Reference’ (MPs FMSYref NFref designed used references actual applications). function MPtype can used determine MP’s type, e.g MPtype('AvC'). Increased flexibility selectivity, retention, discard mortality controls: MPs can now modify selectivity retention curves, also modify level discard mortality. Historical MPAs: new slot MPA added Fleet object. allows users specify historical year fraction area closed. See ?plotMPA example. Improvements MSY reference point calculations: MSY reference points now calculate every year. accounts changes productivity (e.g., increases growth) affect reference points BMSY FMSY. Increased number areas: default DLMtool 2-area model. code now updated include areas required. Movement age: now possible specify movement age, ontogenetic migration offshore Parallel processing: runMSE optimized parallel processing. default, parallel processing used nsim<=48. suggest testing OM low number simulations (e.g nsim=48) increasing number simulations using parallel processing: runMSE(OM, MPs, parallel=TRUE). Update messages displayed parallel mode. Taxonomic information: New slots added Stock object record common name taxonomic details.

title: DLMtool 5.1
text: Converge function updated improved convergence diagnostics. new performance metric (PM) class added. allows users develop custom set performance metrics management system. series example PM objects created (see avail('PM')). time summary plotting functions updated take set PM objects. See Tplot3 example.

title: DLMtool 5.1
text: Many improvements functions (e.g MPs) improve robustness avoid model crashes due stochastic sampling parameters. code DLMtool now tested using testthat package ensure functions work expected. Please continue file bug reports : https://github.com/DLMtool/DLMtool/issues

title: DLMtool 5.1
text: User Manual completely revised updated. Use userguide() access. Please submit typo corrections suggestions improvement https://github.com/DLMtool/DLMtool_UserGuide/issues. Pull requests welcome. developing online library DLMtool OMs (http://www.datalimitedtoolkit.org/fishery_library) OM Report, OM Excel file, OM R data object DLMtool OM. standardized MSE report development. OM library expanded new OMs developed. Please contact us developed OMs able make publicly available. DLMtool user forum development launched soon. idea forum provide platform DLMtool users ask questions share experience DLMtool team.
